message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with covert communication over a broadcast channel, which involves information theory and cryptography. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also involves network information theory, which falls under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper mentions Gaussian and discrete channels, which are related to cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper discusses the optimal strategy for covert communication, which can be considered as a form of game theory, falling under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
